sentences.en: A wise believer understands the essence of Buddhism, Those who are superstitious misinterpret the virtue of religion.
sentences.cn: 智信者深体佛法之精神, 迷信者曲解宗教之美意.

sentences.en: Did he misinterpret and misrepresent the theory he claimed to cherish so much?
sentences.cn: 难道他曲解和歪曲了他声称所珍惜的理论 吗 ?

sentences.en: Don't misinterpret my comments as criticism; She misconstrued my remarks.
sentences.cn: 别把我的评论误解成恶意的批评; 她曲解了我的评论.

sentences.en: Don't misinterpret my comments as criticism.
sentences.cn: 不要把我的话误以为是批评.

sentences.en: If the program expresses itself with Boolean notation, the user can be expected to misinterpret it.
sentences.cn: 如果程序用布尔符号来表达,你看着吧, 用户很可能会曲解.

sentences.en: It is easy to misinterpret these findings.
sentences.cn: 这些发现很容易被曲解.

sentences.en: It would be easy to misinterpret results from such a small sample.
sentences.cn: 从这样小的一份抽样出发容易得出曲解的结论.

sentences.en: Misinterpret the sign, they will get shut out.
sentences.cn: 如果对信号识别失误, 他们将被排斥在外.

sentences.en: People often misinterpret what simplification means. It a way to remove work from your life.
sentences.cn: 人们往往误解了简化生活的意思, 这要你放弃所工作.

sentences.en: People often misinterpret what simplification means. It's not a way to remove work from your life.
sentences.cn: 人们常常误解简化生活的意思, 这不是要你放弃所有的工作.

sentences.en: People often misinterpret what simplify means.
sentences.cn: 人们往往误解了简单的含义.

sentences.en: People often misinterpret what simplify means. It's not a way to remove work from your life.
sentences.cn: 许多人误解了“简化”的含义, 它不是指将工作从生活中划掉.

sentences.en: Please allow me to assure you that you partially misinterpret my emotions.
sentences.cn: 请允许我向你说清楚,你部分地误解了我的感情.

sentences.en: Some parts of the report could be misinterpreted.
sentences.cn: 报告的某些部分可能会被误解。

sentences.en: There is nothing of the kind in what they said; you always try to misinterpret the words of others.
sentences.cn: 他们说的绝不是那么一回事, 你总是想曲解别人的话.

sentences.en: This was to an evidence that the priests could not misinterpret.
sentences.cn: 这证据是祭司们所无法歪曲的.这就是基督延迟到伯大尼去的原因.

trans.tran_en: to not understand the correct meaning of something that someone says or does, or of facts that you are considering
